alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Carter; Greenup; Lawrence (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 2:09PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Boyd, south central Greenup, northwestern Lawrence and southeastern Carter Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 209 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Denton, or 9 miles southeast of Grayson, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ashland, Grayson, Blaine, Yatesville Lake State Park, Cannonsburg, Kenova, Catlettsburg, Webbville, Princess, Durbin, Coalton, Denton, Rush, South Point, Summit, Willard, Hitchins, Buchanan, Houckville and Fallsburg. This includes Interstate 64 in Kentucky between mile markers 170 and 191. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
